alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 28 at 5:46PM AKDT until August 29 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys and Upper Koyukuk Valley from Bettles west. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rain may result in flooding of smaller rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. At this time, flooding of the mainstem of the Koyukuk, Noatak and Kobuk Rivers is not expected, but those rivers will see sharp rises this week with water overbank in some low lying locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Between 2 to 4 inches of rain has fallen over the Upper Noatak Valley, Kobuk Valley, and the Koyukuk Valley from the Dalton Highway west. Another 0.5 inches of rain is expected over these same areas through early Tuesday. Streams and smaller rivers in these basins are already running high, and the additional rain could push them overbank over the next several days. Flooding of low lying areas is possible through Wednesday. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Koyukuk Valley
